column4: hi again guys, I tried installing git on terminal, yet I got this error in return:
Package git has no installation candidate
is git-core
no problem
use ~/.profile
bash reads it

it is equivalent. paste it to ~/.profile
yes
I need to paste this line to bash_profile :[[ -s "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm" ]] && . "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm"  # This loads RVM into a shell session.
profile is only read on login
log out and log in
thanks
, I log out and log in as you said

in you home. like ~/.profile ~/.bashrc
both are using by bash. bashrc is read everytime bash startes profile only on login
